Module edu.uoc.trip
Package edu.uoc.trip.model.levels

Class Level

java.lang.Object
edu.uoc.trip.model.levels.Level
public class Level
extends java.lang.Object
Class that represents each level of the game.
Author:
David García-Solórzano

    • Level

      public Level​(java.lang.String fileName) throws LevelException
      Constructor
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file that contains level's data.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is any error while parsing the file.

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Getter of the attribute "size".
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute "size".

    • setSize

      private void setSize​(int size) throws LevelException
      Setter of the attribute "size".
      Parameters:
      size - New value of the attribute "size".
      Throws:
      LevelException - If the size is less than MINIMUM_BOARD_SIZE.

    • getDifficulty

      public LevelDifficulty getDifficulty()
      Getter of the attribute "difficulty".
      Returns:
      New value of the attribute "difficulty".

      difficulty - Difficulty of the level

      public int getNumMoves()
      Getter of the attribute "numMoves".
      Returns:
      Value of the attribute "numMoves".

    • setNumMoves

      private void setNumMoves​(int numMoves)
      Setter of the attribute "numMoves".
      Parameters:
      numMoves - New value of the attribute "numMoves".

    • parse

      private void parse​(java.lang.String fileName) throws LevelException
      Parses/Reads level's data from the given file.
      It also checks which the board's requirements are met.
      Parameters:
      fileName - Name of the file that contains level's data.
      Throws:
      LevelException - When there is any error while parsing the file or some board's requirement is not satisfied.

    • getFirstNonEmptyLine

      private java.lang.String getFirstNonEmptyLine​(java.io.BufferedReader br) throws java.io.IOException
      This a helper method for parse(String fileName) which returns the first non-empty and non-comment line from the reader.
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader object to read from.
      Returns:
      First line that is a parsable line, or null there are no lines to read.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the reader fails to read a line.

    • validatePosition

      private boolean validatePosition​(Coordinate coord)
      Checks if the cell (row,column) is correct, i.e. it exists on the board. Row in [0,SIZE) and column in [0,SIZE).
      Parameters:
      coord - Object with the info of row and column.
      Returns:
      True if the cell (row,column) exists on the board. Otherwise, false.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell​(Coordinate coord) throws LevelException
      Returns the cell that is in the coordinate/position "coord".
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate/Position of the cell that we want to get.
      Returns:
      The cell which is in the "coord" position in the board.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If the coordinate is invalid.

    • setCell

      private void setCell​(Coordinate coord, Cell cell) throws LevelException
      If the coordinate is valid, then it sets the given cell in the board.
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate/Position of the cell that we want to get.
      cell - New cell which we want to set in the position "coord".
      Throws:
      LevelException - When the coordinate is invalid.

    • swapCells

      public void swapCells​(Coordinate firstCoord, Coordinate secondCoord) throws LevelException
      If it is possible, it swaps the cells in the given coordinates.
      Moreover, if the swap is successful, then it increases the number of moves.
      Parameters:
      firstCoord - Coordinate/Position of the first cell that we want to swap.
      secondCoord - Coordinate/Position of the second cell that we want to swap.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If the coordinate/position is invalid or the cell in that coordinate cannot be moved.

    • rotateCell

      public void rotateCell​(Coordinate coord) throws LevelException
      Given the coordinate of a cell, it rotates that cell if it is possible.
      Moreover, if the rotation is successful, then it increases the number of moves.
      Parameters:
      coord - Coordinate/Position of the cell that the player wants to rotate.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If the coordinate/position is invalid or the cell in that coordinate cannot be rotated.

    • isSolved

      public boolean isSolved() throws LevelException
      Checks if the level is solved.
      Returns:
      True if the level is solved (i.e. there is a path from the starting cell to the finish cell). Otherwise, it returns false.
      Throws:
      LevelException - If there is any problem while checking if the level is solved.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the board in textual format, i.e.:
      1234
      a|····
      b|····
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      String which contains the text-based board.
